title: Textile, 1960–61
medium:
Medium: wool (weft and embroidery), silk (warp), cotton (embroidery) 
Technique: machine embroidered and discharge printed on jacquard weave
inscribed: Attached label: Fabric imported from Italy".
dimensions:
Warp x Weft: 118.5 x 88 cm (46 5/8 x 34 5/8 in.)
Repeat H (printed): 70.5 cm (27 3/4 in.)
Repeat H (embroidered): 5 cm (1 15/16 in.)
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of Marion K. Morgan and from General Acquisitions Endowment, Sarah Cooper-Hewitt, and Eleanor G. Hewitt Funds
description: Textured surface created by machine embroidery on a jacquard-woven surface. A large-scale, abstract leaf pattern in browns and greens is superimposed over a small-scale repeating leaf pattern in black and white.

tombstone.epitaph:
Textile, 1960–61.
1960–61. Medium: wool (weft and embroidery), silk (warp), cotton (embroidery) 
Technique: machine embroidered and discharge printed on jacquard weave. Museum purchase through gift of Marion K. Morgan and from General Acquisitions Endowment, Sarah Cooper-Hewitt, and Eleanor G. Hewitt Funds. 1991-90-10.
